newsitem.title: BELGIUM: EU slaps duties on three countries' flint lighters.
newsitem.headline: EU slaps duties on three countries' flint lighters.

text.p: The European Union has applied definitive anti-dumping duties on gas-fuelled, non-refillable pocket flint lighters from Thailand, the Philippines and Mexico, the bloc's Official Journal (OJ) said on Friday.

Duties on Thai-origin lighters will be 51.9 percent, with the exception of those produced by Politop Co, Ltd, Bangkok, for which the rate will be 5.8 percent and those by Thai Merry Co, Ltd, Samutsakorn, which will not be hit by duties, it said.

Philippine-origin lighters will face 43 percent duties, with the exception of those made and sold for export to the EU by Swedish Match Philippines, Inc, which will face 17 percent duties and those lighters produced by Iwax Philippine Inc, Rosario, Cavite, or Iwahori Philippines, Inc, Mariveles, Bataan, which will all be duty free, the OJ said.
All Mexican-produced lighters will face 27.1 percent duties bar those made by JMP Mexico, SA de CV, Tijuana, which will be duty free.
Duties enter into force from Friday.

The European Union, along with the United States, is one of the more enthusiastic users of anti-dumping measures, which are legal, albeit controversial trade measures used by countries trying to ward off competition from exporters they see as unfairly dumping product on their markets or as using predatory pricing to build up market share.
